comment: GREAT GAME!its exactly what the new sim city should of been... i didnt realize you can buy new land plots as you go along... your cities can be massive comparied to the new sim city. its still challanging and complex like you would want it to be. managing your city and planning your city out is extreamly important... as well as managing your traffic, schools, police ect ect...there are little nic nac's that i dont like... but thank god that the game has full mod support. what i thought was extreamly annoying can be fixed though mods... for example, people will not tear down old abandoned buildings or burnt buildings to construct new ones... you have to bulldoze them your self..there is a mod for auto bulldozing buildings...i didnt like the lack of controlle when building offramps to high ways... there is a mod for that...didnt like the lack of prebuild intersections... there are mods for that...10/10 if you like sim games.i only have 2 tiles to build on in my citty so far, and that alone is a massive land area, and i havent even scratched the surface of the unlockes yet either. really wish i would of played the game alot earlyer then i did.great game.

title: Recommended
comment: All I can say for this game is, wow. This game came from a small company, and they managed to outsell Simcity, a hugely successful game in the past. In the days when it was first released, I was awstruck with how open the world was. It was not as beautiful as simcity then, sad to say. As a year went by, many things were added, like playing on 81 tiles, through a mod, tunnels, day and night, weather. It became quite beautiful and full of potencial. It is the most creative city builder I have ever played. The vanilla game itself is a little sparse though, such as with tall buildings. It almost becomes a requirement for the player to go to the steam workshop to add assets and what not to the game.But, the downside of this game is that to be able to utilize all of the possibilites of mods and assets to the full extent, you need a medium to top notch computer. Not to say you need one to play. You can play it fine with a few add ons. Paradox, please do not lose the values that you incorparated into this game franshise, like the modding community and creative freedom. If you learn from the mistakes of others, such as the failure of always online in simcity, you can make a hugely successful game that out competes everyone else. You made a great game here, and I hope you support it for years to come, and maintain the modding community like sim city 4 did. I hope you stick to the same values as you did here for your next city builder game.I give this game a 15/10. I absolutely love this game.

title: Recommended
comment: What do I say about Cities Skylines? Is it what Sim City 5 should have been? No. The game is barely playable in its basic form. The base game could not even compare to Sim City 4. It is also is not as fun Sim city 2013. This game had a lot of different goals and achievements which can lead to hours and hours of game-play trying to figure out how to optimize each map for optimal resource harvesting. However, Cites Skylines has an amazing community of players, modders and asset makers that makes the game great and very realistic. With saying that though once you start modding and downloading assets the game can become very unstable if you are not careful. The interface that is used to add, download and organize the mods and assets is less then adequate, and can become complicated with assets that contain props and dependencies. It is also extremely slow and temperamental. In addition, the game also needs to be better optimized for multi-cored systems and higher end graphics cards to improved performance in the later stages of the game. Overall though I played over 1000 hours so once you get a good city going it can be hard to peel yourself away from the screen. Once you get over what the game is missing, the graphical and interface challenges, the game can be quite.. addictive.

title: Recommended
comment: Cities: Skylines, the best thing ever.TLDR: Well worth the money. Try it out, see if you enjoy it.I have written a few long reviews prior for different games, I'll try and keep this short. However, this game is just too fun. I usually play shooters, and RTS games, and I really thought when I purchased it that it would be poop. NOPE. I WAS WAY TO WRONG. It provides gameplay that is so simple, yet so good. The mods provide sexy additions which helps a lot. Steam workshop IS apart of C:Skylines. Very convient!Anyways, to the main review.Graphics: The game is VERY beautiful. I have a powerful-ish rig, and it runs too good on it. One of my friends has a pc from 2009 (very outdated, a ati hd 3450 and intel pentium). and he gets 50fps on it low. The game is optimized and the developers did a darn good job doing so. 9.5/10Sound: It sounds like a real city. I'd say it sounds very good and detailed. 8.5/10 A big higher quality would be better, but I am not focusing on the sound, as most people that play this aren't playing it for the sound.Gameplay: Well, heres the real deal. It's VERY good. Alright, I think I'm going to hire Donald Trump to say it: "It's YUUUUGGEEEE and very great folks!" Yes, it's very great. Honestly, you WILL spend hours on this. You could say: "Eh, I'm going to play for an hour"... *2 hours later* "Well, another 30 minutes"... *2 hours later*... "Oh, ****, my bad for missing work!". (Just kidding, but it's very addicting to those seeking a good city builder, and sandbox game. The gameplay is smooth and pretty simple. You will NOT break your back trying to learn the ropes. It might take some practice to not have as much traffic jams, and doing roads correctly... but that is where your creativity comes in. Either way, to make it short... 9.7/10. (I would like to see smarter AI in the base game)Re-Playable: I consider re-playable to be: You can play it times and times again, with no issue getting back into it. It will last you HOURS... and probably months. Especially with Steam WS! 10/10Overall: 9.5/10, just a devine and sexy game. I like flooding my citizens if they have a bad attitude. (Oh, they like getting wet).TLDR; Worth the money. Play it, I am 99.99% sure you will love it.MY ONE TIP: MAKE SURE YOU PLAN YOUR ZONES OUT. Industrial zones should have a direct connection to the highway. As well as commercial zones. Make sure you get a mass transit system up too. It helps. AND you WILL likely have traffic jams. DO NOT FLIP OUT. You can solve it by adding more exits/enterances and spacing out the zones.

title: Recommended
comment: From loving games such as Sim City and Roller coaster Tycoon I have been looking for a good city management game for some time. I can spend countless hours reworking roads to improve traffic flow and find laying water pips to be a peaceful experience. If that’s you, you might want to give this game a go.Unlike sim city, which it barrows heavily from there are no disasters. The biggest threat to your citizens will be fire. My few play throws the fire became a pain in how many burnt buildings I had to bulldoze. Though that was partly my fault I got rid of a street connecting the fire house. You could say the game was trying to bring my attention to this by burning the people of my city.City: Skylines is the definition of a city builder simulation game. Its goal is to give you the tools to create a prosperous city the way you see fit. Through a wonderful mechanic called districts I could regulate an industry heavy district to provide farm goods. Personally I like my cities to be eco-friendly and concentrate on resident happiness instead of trying to make the most profitable city I can.From years of playing these types of games, the fun comes from living the fantasy of running your own city your way. City: Skylines seems to understand this. From their UI and overall look of the game people will compare it to Sim City 2013. Though I think as time goes on people will start to point out how this game sets it self apart. You can only see this through playing it. It's a warm and welcoming feeling for people that want to dive into a city they can make into their own.This game also comes with a map and assets editor. From little I got to play with this feature I have to say its nice to create your own intersections to use in your maps. It keeps things uniform and saves you time from wasting cash and deleting unnecessary from roads that you have to replace, anyways.The developers have thought of steam workshop integrating from the get go. From seeing games of this type try to integrate other players into your game, like having a multiplayer function I much rather have this type of integration where players can add to each other's cities through making unique props, buildings and intersections.I would recommend this game to anyone that love city management games. It's one of the better ones.

comment: Cities: Skylines is the new gold standard for city builder simulation games, and will be for the foreseeable future (probably until Cities: Skylines 2 in 5-10 years if Paradox can think of ways to develop a sequel that improves on the original). If you were a SimCity fan disappointed by Maxis' last SimCity (2013) but still like the genre, don't hesistate, C:S is the new standard bearer. If you're price sensitive, wait for it to go on sale, and it'll be a great deal you can sink hours into.Pluses:+Active mod community+Ongoing development with value-add expansions and DLCsMinuses:-No multiplayer, e.g. the regional maps in SimCity 2013

title: Recommended
comment: Citites: Skylines is both more forgiving and more in-depth than the likes of SimCity 4. Running out of money is a lot tougher, and there's a lot more to manage like the size of your roads, sewage, and cemetaries. The game starts off really slow as, unline in SimCity where unlocks are based on the year, the unlocks here are based on population, so you start off with coal power and no high-density zoning. Over time, the game opens up, and you get a lot of room to build and experiment. If you like city builders, this game is definitely a solid 9/10, it shines in comparison to the likes of the newer and even the classic SimCities.

title: Recommended
comment: This game is pretty good. It simulates building beautiful cities well and the player has a decent level of freedom in what they build. Mods enable a higher level. Speaking of mods there are quite a few great ones that should be in the base game. Like the ability to turn sirens off, without this mod everytime you move the camera to street level you will be deafened by ambo, fire and police sirens.Whats lacking from this game is dept in its management element, what's present is Ultra basic and really boring. I would have liked to see a large expansion to this element, I fear however that if they did get around to explaining city management it would likely be costly DLC.A lot of the dlc for this game isn't worth it so consider if it adds elements your like vs how much it costs.

title: Recommended
comment: I am very, very picky about my city builder games. City builders and strategy games (such as Civ 5) are neck and neck for my favorite genre and have the most playtime by far than any other type of game.Also, it is exceedingly rare that I rate anything 10/10. I am one of those people who will rate something 9/10. You really have to blow me away to get a 10/10 out of me. That being said, I am giving this game 10/10.It is the best city builder ever created, hands down and I have been playing them since Sim City 2000 came out. This blows Sim City 5 completely out of the water and is obviously targeted to do so (the price point, mod-ability, and city size).Playing the game or reading the other positive reviews will tell you why that is the case, so I won't get into the gritty details.

title: Recommended
comment: Cities skylines is truly a great city building and simulation game. With hundreds of hours of fun, it is really really worth the purchase. If you are a fan of older simcity games, or were disappointed with Simcity 5, you HAVE to give this game a try, it is worth well up into the 60$ range for me, and yet it is only 30 dollars.They are planning on releasing free updates and MAJOR dlc packs (not like 1 new road thats 20$), and they have already released 3 new maps and a whole different type of city style (European) for FREE. Not only that, but they fully support modding, and if you somehow get bored with the base game, you have a whole new experience waiting for you at the workshop.If your on the verge of buying the game, get it right now. Trust me, it is well worth the money.

title: Recommended
comment: I bought this game hoping for a breathtaking experience of what a city simulation builder should be.I got into the game and was greeted with a very nice menu with some nice music to add a bit of atmosphere to the game which I liked but at times it got kind of annoying forcing me to turn the music of.I got into the game and had a bunch of responibilites to do as expected from a city building game at first it took getting use to as i have not played many city builders in my time so if you are in the same situation i was you may struggle at getting to grips with the game at first which is frustrating because the first responibilities keep your city going if done, there is plenty of begginers guides on Youtube though and they should teach you within 10 minutes of how to get the basics of this game.Once i got the basics of the game, i was enjoying it it had really good features like, bans, tax rises, even a smoking ban stuff like this can really help your city, i also like the in depth stats so like traffic and so on it the stats really show you enough to guide you on and know what you need to do when fixing a problem which is great!The people, well the people that populate your city are well to say the least demanding which is expected when they have no power or water once they have the basics though it always seems they have something to complain about and create a problem out of nothing which can be anoying so you have to keep on top of your people.Some things i would like to bring up, is the realism of the game i see a lot of people comparing this to Sim City, having never played Sim City i have heard of a lot of people that Skylines is the more advanced and realistic game which well benefit you depending what sort of player you are but anyway as i was saying the realism of the game!I find it great i love stuff from rising water levels, to just traffic which brings me on to another point about this game that i found great, traffic has a purpose instead of just wandering around everyone you see in traffic is going somewhere which really add's to the realism of the game.So the negatives, well like every game this game has it's negatives as well so let's get on to it.Although a good game, it's negatives well aint really full on negatives but i would count them as coming across as negatives and they are!Repitivnes, like every game it get's a bit boring and after a while i feel once you have made a few worlds and done everything on this which is achievable to do in a fast amount of time the game get's boring, but if you really like these sort of games then i can see you having a good time with this!So should you buy this game?YES! this game is currently retailing at £5.94 at

comment: So much DLC!Would recommend for any world builder or simulation fan but only on sale.Recommended DLC: After Dark (includes cycle lanes and dedicated bus lanes to enhance public transport system).Good+ I did enjoy this game a lot, however, I would not recommend buying it unless on sale. The game is not worth the price especially if you were considering purchasing DLC as well.+ Easy to get the hang of the game so you can focus on building great cities.+ No issues with lagging or glitches.+ Very addictive.+ DLC is not essential to play some have great features that do benefit the game. Once again however, buy these on sale they are very overpriced. Do your research about which will benefit your vision for your city. After Dark does seem to be the top recomendation.- Again with the DLC!! Not willing to pay $3.50 for a radio station. Some of the DLC are complete ripoffs for their price. Looking into it they only add a couple of features for what you pay.- Very addictive.* DLCOverall the biggest gripe is the amount of DLC attached to the game and the cost of them but these are not essential for most players.

comment: So after trying this game on hard mode without any mods it is way more challenging. So challenging no one moves into your city. After reinstalling the game people started moving in. I have spent hours building my city...I think I will spend hours more.Don't get me wrong...I love this game. It is just too easy. Without any sort of tutorials or trying to make an extremely efficient city I was able to get to 80k residents in 6 hours of gameplay. I will continue to play the game but being able to unlock everything in so little time is quite a bit of a turn off for me. Still a great game. If it is signifigantly harder with the hard mode on I will try that, but otherwise it seems like my review is going to have to be negative.

comment: I feel like a year after release I have a good opinion on the game, its DLC and the devs.Good:- Massive scale, huge maps and up to 1,000,000 people can live in your city- Mods & Steam workshop support (probably the best thing about this game)- Looks cute- Overall a very enjoyable city builder- Free updates everytime they release a DLC- CheapBad:- Traffic can be stupid at times and is your worst enemy.- Deathwaves - people tend to die at the same time, so half of your city will be covered in corpses every once in a while- Edges look weird, even with AA- Performance issues- DLC is a bit overpriced- You can't see♥♥♥♥♥♥at night- Rain has no soundVerdict:Although I stopped playing I feel like I got my money's worth. It is better than Sim City and solves a lot of its problems but at the same time it has its own issues. There are mods to improve almost every issue I have with this game but it can get tiring to be forced to install them. More DLC is planned, the devs seem like nice people and I generally recommend this game at any price.

comment: GREAT GAME!its exactly what the new sim city should of been... i didnt realize you can buy new land plots as you go along... your cities can be massive comparied to the new sim city. its still challanging and complex like you would want it to be. managing your city and planning your city out is extreamly important... as well as managing your traffic, schools, police ect ect...there are little nic nac's that i dont like... but thank god that the game has full mod support. what i thought was extreamly annoying can be fixed though mods... for example, people will not tear down old abandoned buildings or burnt buildings to construct new ones... you have to bulldoze them your self..there is a mod for auto bulldozing buildings...i didnt like the lack of controlle when building offramps to high ways... there is a mod for that...didnt like the lack of prebuild intersections... there are mods for that...10/10 if you like sim games.i only have 2 tiles to build on in my citty so far, and that alone is a massive land area, and i havent even scratched the surface of the unlockes yet either. really wish i would of played the game alot earlyer then i did.great game.

title: Recommended
comment: All I can say for this game is, wow. This game came from a small company, and they managed to outsell Simcity, a hugely successful game in the past. In the days when it was first released, I was awstruck with how open the world was. It was not as beautiful as simcity then, sad to say. As a year went by, many things were added, like playing on 81 tiles, through a mod, tunnels, day and night, weather. It became quite beautiful and full of potencial. It is the most creative city builder I have ever played. The vanilla game itself is a little sparse though, such as with tall buildings. It almost becomes a requirement for the player to go to the steam workshop to add assets and what not to the game.But, the downside of this game is that to be able to utilize all of the possibilites of mods and assets to the full extent, you need a medium to top notch computer. Not to say you need one to play. You can play it fine with a few add ons. Paradox, please do not lose the values that you incorparated into this game franshise, like the modding community and creative freedom. If you learn from the mistakes of others, such as the failure of always online in simcity, you can make a hugely successful game that out competes everyone else. You made a great game here, and I hope you support it for years to come, and maintain the modding community like sim city 4 did. I hope you stick to the same values as you did here for your next city builder game.I give this game a 15/10. I absolutely love this game.

comment: The best city builder out there in my opinion. The main focus of the game is managing traffic and public transit systems though that really shouldn't be a surprise. Planning road layouts is essential, unless you'd rather have gridlock, and I suppose that can make or break the game for some people. If that sounds like something you would enjoy then this game is probably for you. I find coming up with creative solutions to solve traffic problems very satisfying myself, and of course I love building the ultimate skyline! So many good mods available on the workshop too if you like modding your games.

title: Recommended
comment: This is my first review for a game, because I'm mostly lazy and would just rather play.. lol but if you're looking for an honest review then this would be one to read.This game is developed amazingly and I'm amazed how creative you can be in Cities Skylines. There isn't too much negative to talk about this game, the only thing that could come to mind is the traffic flow - but that's really just a matter of how you builld your road network. Another tip on traffic flow is consider changing up traffic patterns, switching different intersections, create roundabouts, etc. Roundabouts cause alot of confusion because not much people know how to properly use one. The AI in the game handles roundabouts pretty well if used in the right spots so keep that in mind.The steam workshop support is amazing and if you need any tools to help build your city and make you a successful city-builder, some tools created in the workshop definitely help you get the job done.I haven't played much other city-building type simulators, but I can guarantee that this would be one that is well worth the money. It may or may not be a little pricey depending on your budget, but the gameplay and endless possibilities is worth it. Every gameplay is different when loading into the game.. don't like how your city is doing? Wipe it out and begin another. Even on the same map you load, you can create new ideas on how you city wants to look. For new users - it will honestly be trial and error on how to plan your city. You are free and welcome to change it up however you see fit.I do recommend this game for numerous reasons and if you ever come across something that you feel is negative about the game.. I really don't believe it's an ice breaker by any means. It'll always be something you can work around and play around with. So for those that intend to purchase this game, good luck and happy building!

comment: well, they just released a $30 DLC that adds tunnels and 50 new buildings, but the new buildings are only offered as exclusive content to players who pre-ordered the DLC. I was going to give a review on how the new tunnels work, but the game servers are crashing and overloaded because everyone is trying to play at once! Unfortunately it's got always-online DRM so the server issues (that can generally be reliably forecasted and predicted as this happens with any major game / DLC release) are preventing me from enjoying my single player experience. I guess the publisher and dev studio also told outright lies to their consumers regarding the necessity of the always-online requirement and absolutely none of this is true in fact I might be thinking of the wrong game entirely.10/10 would pay the full price of the failed predecessing competitor game to have my hopes and dreams utterly crushed, then pay the full price of Cities:Skylines to impossibly restore and rejuvinate my spirits in the rebound of the F%#&!*NG century.

title: Recommended
comment: From loving games such as Sim City and Roller coaster Tycoon I have been looking for a good city management game for some time. I can spend countless hours reworking roads to improve traffic flow and find laying water pips to be a peaceful experience. If that’s you, you might want to give this game a go.Unlike sim city, which it barrows heavily from there are no disasters. The biggest threat to your citizens will be fire. My few play throws the fire became a pain in how many burnt buildings I had to bulldoze. Though that was partly my fault I got rid of a street connecting the fire house. You could say the game was trying to bring my attention to this by burning the people of my city.City: Skylines is the definition of a city builder simulation game. Its goal is to give you the tools to create a prosperous city the way you see fit. Through a wonderful mechanic called districts I could regulate an industry heavy district to provide farm goods. Personally I like my cities to be eco-friendly and concentrate on resident happiness instead of trying to make the most profitable city I can.From years of playing these types of games, the fun comes from living the fantasy of running your own city your way. City: Skylines seems to understand this. From their UI and overall look of the game people will compare it to Sim City 2013. Though I think as time goes on people will start to point out how this game sets it self apart. You can only see this through playing it. It's a warm and welcoming feeling for people that want to dive into a city they can make into their own.This game also comes with a map and assets editor. From little I got to play with this feature I have to say its nice to create your own intersections to use in your maps. It keeps things uniform and saves you time from wasting cash and deleting unnecessary from roads that you have to replace, anyways.The developers have thought of steam workshop integrating from the get go. From seeing games of this type try to integrate other players into your game, like having a multiplayer function I much rather have this type of integration where players can add to each other's cities through making unique props, buildings and intersections.I would recommend this game to anyone that love city management games. It's one of the better ones.

Overall a great game with a great community!

title: Recommended
comment: Cities: Skylines is an amazing city builder. I haven't playes a Sim city game in a long time, admittedly, but Cities: Skylines really brings the genre to the forefront.The logic to this game is very good, where every peice of traffic or people actually has something to do, rather than just being cosmetic. This does make things a bit trickier, but overall that is much more fun. Similarly, the mechanics of district zoning is something I hadn't expected, but turns out to be really useful.Things do tend to get a bit hectic when you end up with a large population [>100,000], but that may just be due to my own lack of experience.The audio graphical design to this game are really good. It makes it a joy to just sink in to playing for hours. From a wide angle view of the environment, right down to the models of buildings and vehicles it all looks and sounds great. The interface isn't overly complex or cluttered, and it is easy to learn.The modding community to this game is amazing as well, with loads of great content. The devs are even taking hints from various popular mods and integrating relevant additions into the game itself, which is always nice to see. That, and the few gripes I do have about the game [like no tree brushes] can easily be fixed by a mod. They install easily, and I haven't had any game breakages from them.This game is definitely worth buyng if you like city builders, or simulator games of any kind.

title: Recommended
comment: This game will eek its way into your dreams. Have you every dreamed about roads? You will dream about roads. Have you every really looked at that highyway intersection you drive by every day? You will also dream about highway intersections. Did you decide not to become a traffic engineer or city planner? You will decide to quit your job and become one. That's how awesome this game is.

title: Recommended
comment: A nice successor to SimCity.I have been playing this game on and off for months and I can say it is addictive if you played SimCity (and its many variations) when you were a kid. Plan everything from basic infrastructure and all sorts of buildings for your city in the asset editor. If you are like me and cannot build something without rage quitting (LOL), there are a LOT of mods and assets in the workshop to customize the look of your city. The game is pretty resource-intensive so I would not recoomend playing it with a plain PC (at least you need a dedicated video card).
